page.title: 02THE ICE-AGE
page.content: During the Ice-age there was at some stage a vast barrier of ice to the east of the river Breamish. This prevented the escape of river melt- water. Water built up into the valley forming a vast lake. As one travels up the valley today you can clearly see the shore-line of this glacial lake some 50 to 100 feet above the present valley floor. The water actually flowed out of the lake at the nearby village of Powburn, through a deep glacial overflow channel and into a similar lake in the neighbouring Aln valley.
